title: Wurlitzer 125 Band Organ - Enchanted Carousel (320)
description:
Wurlitzer 125 Band Organ - Enchanted Carousel (320)

Granted, this isn't for everyone, but for the listener who likes the unusual or the pirate who wants everything, this is a must-have.  The Wurlitzer 125 Band Organ was a bit like a player piano on steroids.  They had pipes, drums, and perhaps a few other things as well.  They were fully automated, having no pedals, stops, or keyboards like a standard organ, but were controlled by rolls of punched paper, similar to a player piano.  They were used anywhere a showman wanted a lot of noise without the accompanying expense and trouble of a live band: carnivals, side shows, and of course, carousels.

You'll probably find yourself suffering from a debilitating case of listener's fatigue if you try to consume all of these tracks in one shot, but before you turn it off, skip ahead to the final track, "The Merry-Go-Round Broke Down".  It's a hoot to listen to and makes the CD well worth the price.

1.  Chicken Reel
2.  Gimme Dat Ding
3.  Put Another Nickel In
4.  Paddy Wac
5.  Sugar Time
6.  76 Trombones
7.  March from the River Kwai/Colonel Bogey
8.  Turkey in the Straw
9.  Chattanooga Shoe Shine Boy
10. Caberet
11. Those Were the Days
12. Thoroughly Modern Millie
13. Moon River Waltz
14. Candy Man
15. It's Not Unusual
16. Hello, Dolly!
17. Beer Barrel Polka
18. The Woodpecker Song
19. Blue Jackets March
20. Umbrella Man
21. In a Little Spanish Town
22. Peggy O'Neal
23. Maria Elena
24. Clara
25. Georgia on My Mind
26. God Bless America
27. Charleston
28. Blue Skirt Waltz
29. Organ Grinder's Swing
30. Dixieland March
31. The Merry-Go-Round Broke Down
